titleStmt.title: Description of Commentary on the Prophets.

availability.licence: This metadata, accompanying images, and the content of London, British Library, Oriental Manuscripts Add MS 27008: Commentary on the Prophets. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Zero 1.0 Universal page for usage details, https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/.

The [British] Library respects the intellectual property rights, including moral rights, of rights holders and makes all reasonable effort to contact and consult rights owners, including, where appropriate, communities directly, or via local community organisations. Given the importance of the historical record, and the fact that that some of our digitised collections include materials that are sensitive to particular communities and groups, we ask that any use of the digitised collections is undertaken with the appropriate care. Irrespective of its copyright status, items and/or collections should not be altered or used in ways that might be derogatory to the originating individuals or communities. (Please follow the link for the complete text of the BL Ethical Terms of Use)

notesStmt.note: Damp entry at edges, with some tidemarks across part of the text. Mould spotting and mottling.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: Guarded as individual leaves before rebinding.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian cursive script of the 16th century. Mordecai ben Judah Dato: an autograph.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Mordechai Dato. Discourses. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,008.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), Italian bibliophile: his manuscript no. 118; 322 Hebrew manuscripts were acquired from his library by the British Museum in 1865 through Asher and Co., Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum: inscribed, folio [49v].
